thread.title: Roy Keane blasts Paul and Florentin Pogba's brotherly show as "nonsense" following Man United's Europa League victory
thread.title_full: Roy Keane blasts Paul and Florentin Pogba's brotherly show as "nonsense" following Man United's Europa League victory

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Roy Keane blasts Paul and Florentin Pogba's brotherly show as "nonsense" following Man United's Europa League victory
text:
Sport Roy Keane blasts Paul and Florentin Pogba's brotherly show as "nonsense" following Man United's Europa League victory The former Red Devils legend thinks the pair were "over the top" - especially when the pair were seen chatting at half time Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Roy Keane blasts Paul and Florentin Pogba's brotherly show Share this video   Thank you for subscribing!   
Roy Keane has blasted Paul and Florentin Pogba's brotherly show as "nonsense" following Manchester United 's 3-0 victory over St Etienne in the Europa League. 
The brothers faced each other in competition format for the very first time on Thursday - and could be seen chatting and embracing before the match. 
Florentin and Paul were also captured chatting at half-time as the duo walked towards the players' tunnel. 
When asked by Jacqui Oatley on ITV's Europa League Highlights show if Paul Pogba chatting to his brother at half-time bothered him, Keane replied: "Yes. Roy Keane speaking on the UEFA Europa League Highlights show on ITV (Photo: ITV) 
"The boy, Pogba, he's a bit of a free spirit, a bit of a character. But I think it was a little bit over the top tonight - before the game and at half-time. 
"They've spoke more tonight than I have to any of my brothers [Denis, Pat and Johnson] in the last five years. Manchester United's Paul Pogba and St Etienne's Florentin Pogba walk off at half time (Photo: REUTERS) 
"It's all a bit strange. I think when the game started they were focused on the game. 
"But all this stuff before and after the game, [it's] a lot of nonsense - but that's the modern player I'm afraid." poll loading Do you agree with Roy Keane's comments on the Pogba brothers? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
